alert.note: Alert for Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 1:04PM EDT until July 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Wells River At Wells River affecting Orange County. For the Waits/Wells Basins...including Wells River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wells River at Wells River. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Water may continue to affect US Highway 302 along the Wells River in Groton, South Ryegate, and Wells River until the river level falls below 6 feet this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM EDT Tuesday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by late this evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...The observed maximum river stage of 7.5 feet is the 9th highest crest in history, and just below what was observed during Tropical Storm Irene where the stage reached 9.0 feet on 8/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
